title: Doseone
text:
Adam Drucker (born April 21, 1977), better known by his stage name Doseone, is an American <a href="rapping">rapper</a>, <a href="hip%20hop%20producer">producer</a>, <a href="poet">poet</a> and <a href="artist">artist</a>. He is a co-founder of the <a href="indie%20hip%20hop">indie hip hop</a> record label <a href="Anticon">Anticon</a>. He has also been a member of numerous groups including <a href="Deep%20Puddle%20Dynamics">Deep Puddle Dynamics</a>, Greenthink, <a href="Clouddead">Clouddead</a>, <a href="Themselves">Themselves</a>, <a href="Subtle%20%28band%29">Subtle</a>, <a href="13%20%26amp%3B%20God">13 & God</a>, Go Dark, <a href="Nevermen">Nevermen</a>, and A7pha.
History.
Doseone is known for his extensive collaborations with other Anticon members, forming numerous groups and performing guest spots on others' releases. He has recorded with many musicians including <a href="Mr.%20Dibbs">Mr. Dibbs</a>, <a href="Aesop%20Rock">Aesop Rock</a>, <a href="Slug%20%28rapper%29">Slug</a>, <a href="Sole%20%28hip%20hop%20artist%29">Sole</a>, <a href="Alias%20%28musician%29">Alias</a>, <a href="Jel%20%28rapper%29">Jel</a>, <a href="Odd%20Nosdam">Odd Nosdam</a>, <a href="Why%3F%20%28American%20band%29">Why?</a>, <a href="Fog%20%28band%29">Fog</a>, <a href="Boom%20Bip">Boom Bip</a>, <a href="The%20Notwist">The Notwist</a> and <a href="Mike%20Patton">Mike Patton</a>. He has also released several solo albums, including the spoken word album "<a href="Soft%20Skulls">Soft Skulls</a>" and a combination audio CD and poetry book "<a href="The%20Pelt">The Pelt</a>".
Early in his musical career, Doseone once competed in a <a href="freestyle%20rap">freestyle rap</a> battle with then-unknown <a href="Eminem">Eminem</a> at <a href="Scribble%20Jam">Scribble Jam</a> in 1997. In 1998, Doseone released his first solo album, "<a href="Hemispheres%20%28Doseone%20album%29">Hemispheres</a>". In 2000, he released "<a href="Circle%20%28Boom%20Bip%20and%20Doseone%20album%29">Circle</a>", a collaborative album with producer <a href="Boom%20Bip">Boom Bip</a>. In 2012, he released the solo album, "<a href="G%20Is%20for%20Deep">G Is for Deep</a>", on <a href="Anticon">Anticon</a>.
Doseone is also a visual artist. He has worked on the cover art for many of the albums he has performed on. He has contributed the artwork on Jel's album "<a href="Soft%20Money%20%28album%29">Soft Money</a>" in 2006. He has also done work in animation. He worked on an online animated cartoon "NOTGarfield". The series consists of characters from "<a href="Garfield">Garfield</a>" involved in surreal <a href="dada">dada</a> situations.
In January 2012 it was announced that <a href="Adult%20Swim">Adult Swim</a> has ordered a pilot of an animated series called "Mars Safari" that will feature a soundtrack by Doseone and Jel. Doseone will star alongside <a href="Steve%20Little%20%28actor%29">Steve Little</a> and <a href="Carl%20Weathers">Carl Weathers</a> to voice the character Emilio.
Doseone has also participated in creating music for indie games, including Sludge Life, <a href="Samurai%20Gunn">Samurai Gunn</a>, Catacomb Kids, <a href="Enter%20the%20Gungeon">Enter the Gungeon</a>, <a href="Vlambeer">Vlambeer</a>'s games Gun Godz and <a href="Nuclear%20Throne">Nuclear Throne</a>, <a href="Messhof">Messhof</a>'s <a href="Nidhogg%202">Nidhogg 2</a>, <a href="Disc%20Room">Disc Room</a> and many other independent games currently in development.
Style.
Doseone is known for his nasal and high pitched voice, fast <a href="polyrhythm">polyrhythm</a>ic rapping style, and extremely dense and abstract lyrics. His words tend to express upon topics of <a href="childhood">childhood</a>, <a href="nature">nature</a>, and American life. While rapping/singing onstage, he often also simultaneously performs on the <a href="synthesizer">synthesizer</a>, <a href="Sampler%20%28musical%20instrument%29">sampler</a>, or <a href="keyboard%20instrument">keyboard</a>.
A recurring character in much of Doseone's work is a man named Hour Hero Yes. He is mentioned in the <a href="13%20%26amp%3B%20God">13 & God</a> song "Ghostwork" as well as throughout albums of his band <a href="Subtle%20%28band%29">Subtle</a>. Album and video artwork, as well as art on Subtle's official website, suggest Hour Hero Yes to be a bald man with a black and white striped face; an image which is embodied by a bust that serves as a <a href="centerpiece">centerpiece</a> prop during live Subtle shows. On the cover of "", he appears in old military garb with fire for hair.

Live albums
EPs
Singles
